document.masterDocTitle: The genus Acledra Signoret, 1864 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae) in Chile

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Acledra Signoret, 1864 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae) in Chile

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Acledra reflexa Signoret, 1864
by monotypy

Acledra albocostata ( Spinola, 1852 )
[ Berg 1900 ] (Correction of Reed’s work)
Remarks: the male of this species remain unknown.

Acledra dimidiaticollis (Spin.)
[ Berg 1900 ] (Correction of Reed’s work)

PLATE I.
Fig, 1.
A. fraterna (Stål)
, habitus; Fig. 2.
A. gregalis Berg
, habitus; Fig. 3.
A. albocostata (Spinola)
, habitus; Fig. 4
A. haematopa (Spinola)
, habitus.

, habitus; Fig. 6.

, habitus; Fig. 7.

A. fraterna (Stål)

A. haematopa (Spinola)

PLATE IV .
Fig. 16.
A. carinata Breddin
, female terminalia, La8: Lateroterguite 8, La9: Lateroterguite 9; Fig. 17.
A. albocostata (Spinola)
, female terminalia.
Remarks: the male of this species remain unknown.

Acledra gregalis Berg, 1878
[Figs. 2–8] Type info:? ( Type series is deposited in the Museo de la Plata , Argentina )

Acledra haematopus Spin.
[ Berg 1900 ] (Correction of Reed’s work)

Remarks: the type series of this species is lost, as are many others of Reed. Berg (1900) wrote that this species should be examined, arguing the insufficient description of Reed (1898) ; Prado (1991) without justification listed it as “doubtful species”; and more lately ( Prado 2008 ) listed it as a valid species. We prefer to treat it as nomen dubium until the type series appears; without these specimens it is impossible to known the status of this species within
Acledra
or if it really belongs to this genus.
